setupwizard.extended: explains concepts with no actions in step
setupwizard.skipSetup.confirm.title: Skip Setup
setupwizard.skipSetup.confirm.message: Are you sure? Setup saves you time by performing just a few basic configuration tasks. You should only skip it if you know what you're doing.
setupwizard.intro.title: Introduction
setupwizard.location.title: Set Location
setupwizard.location.header1: Would you like to set your home's location?
setupwizard.location.header2: It will help determining data dependent on your position, like sunrise/sunset times or the weather.
setupwizard.location.footer: This will ask your device for the permission to use its current location, only to help you fill in your current latitude and longitude above. You can revoke the permission afterwards.
setupwizard.network.title: Select Network
setupwizard.network.header1: openHAB by default restricts some discovery broadcast network traffic to your primary network.
setupwizard.network.header2: Select your server's primary IP address that is part of your primary network.
setupwizard.addon.binding-astro.line1: Calculates many positional and DateTime values for sun and moon as well as sun radiation levels.
setupwizard.addon.automation-jsscripting: Allows JavaScript (ECMAScript) to be used as a script language within automation languages.
Recommended as Blockly depends on it.
setupwizard.addon.misc-openhabcloud.line: Allows access to your local openHAB instance without exposing ports to the Internet or requiring a VPN setup.
Recommended to access openHAB from anywhere.
setupwizard.addon.ui-basic.line1: Lightweight web user interface for Sitemaps.
setupwizard.addon.persistence-rrd4j.line: Stores state of numerical items. Does not grow in size by storing historical data on different levels of granularity.
Recommended if you want to have charts of the historic state of numerical items.
setupwizard.addon.persistence-mapdb.line: Always stores the last state of an item. Allows restoring the state of all items on openHAB startup.
Recommended if you want openHAB to always remember the last state before shutdown.
setupwizard.addon.persistence-inmemory.l: Stores states in memory only. Limits size and does not persist data on disk.
Recommended for temporarily storing forecasts (e.g. weather forecasts).
setupwizard.addons.suggestionsWaitMessag: We are searching the most relevant add-ons for you...
setupwizard.concepts-intro.title: Concepts Intro
setupwizard.concepts-intro.header1: openHAB represents physical entities as Things.
setupwizard.concepts-intro.header2: Bindings can be thought of as software adapters, making Things available to openHAB.
setupwizard.concepts-intro.header3: Items represent capabilities that can be used by applications, either in user interfaces or in automation logic.
setupwizard.concepts-intro.body1: Items are linked to Thing Channels. A single Thing can have multiple capabilities that are linked to multiple Items.
setupwizard.concepts-intro.body2: You need to install and configure one or more Bindings to connect your devices to openHAB.
setupwizard.concepts-intro.body3: Your devices will appear as Things in the Inbox, from where the configuration starts.
setupwizard.concepts-intro.nextDescripti: In the next step you can make a Bindings selection.
setupwizard.binding.title: Install Bindings
setupwizard.binding.header1: openHAB Bindings are the glue between the physical world and your automations.
setupwizard.binding.header2: Select Bindings to match the functionality you require.
setupwizard.binding.header3: A recommended set of Bindings have been pre-selected.
setupwizard.binding.footer: To optimize your system resources, install only the add-ons you need! More bindings can be installed and configured later.
setupwizard.rules-intro.title: Rules Intro
setupwizard.rules-intro.header1: You can automate your house with Rules.
setupwizard.rules-intro.header2: It is easy to define simple rules without programming.
setupwizard.rules-intro.header3: More advanced rules can be written in various programming languages.
setupwizard.rules-intro.body1: You need to install an Automation Add-on to get access to a specific language.
setupwizard.rules-intro.body2: Rules can be created graphically using Blockly. Blockly requires the Javascript Scripting Add-on.
setupwizard.rules-intro.nextDescription: In the next step you can make a Automation Add-ons selection.
setupwizard.automation.title: Install Automation Add-ons
setupwizard.automation.header1: openHAB Automation Add-ons allow you to create rules and automations in various languages.
setupwizard.automation.footer: To optimize your system resources, install only the add-ons you need! More automation Add-ons can be installed and configured later.
setupwizard.ui-intro.title: UI Intro
setupwizard.ui-intro.header1: openHAB comes with powerful User Interface options supported in the browser and mobile apps.
setupwizard.ui-intro.header2: The main UI is available by default and allows you to create attractive end-user Pages.
setupwizard.ui-intro.header3: Sitemaps offer a simple declarative way to create simple UI's.
setupwizard.ui-intro.body1: You can get remote access to openHAB without opening your home network with the openHAB Cloud Connector Add-on.
setupwizard.ui-intro.body2: Sitemap UI's are default in the mobile apps. To use them in a browser, you need to install the Basic UI Add-on.
setupwizard.ui-intro.nextDescription: In the next step you can make a UI Add-ons selection.
setupwizard.ui.title: Install UI Add-ons
setupwizard.ui.header1: Beyond the default UI, you can install other UI Add-ons.
setupwizard.ui.footer: To optimize your system resources, install only the add-ons you need! More UI Add-ons can be installed and configured later.
setupwizard.persistence-intro.title: Persistence Intro
setupwizard.persistence-intro.header1: There are many times in home automation where one wants to keep, chart, and otherwise use the historic states of Items.
setupwizard.persistence-intro.header2: openHAB has the concept of Persistence to achieve this.
setupwizard.persistence-intro.header3: There are many different databases, some embedded and others running as an external service, that are supported for Persistence.
setupwizard.persistence-intro.body1: To use a Persistence service, you need to install a Persistence Add-on and configure it.
setupwizard.persistence-intro.body2: You define Strategies that will control what gets persisted and when. A Restore on Startup Strategy helps restoring the state of your Items when openHAB restarts.
setupwizard.persistence-intro.nextDescri: In the next steps you can make a Persistence Add-ons selection and configure these.
setupwizard.persistence.title: Install Persistence Add-ons
setupwizard.persistence.header1: openHAB relies on persistence add-ons to store and retrieve historic states.
setupwizard.persistence.header2: Select persistence add-ons to match the functionality you require.
setupwizard.persistence.footer: To optimize your system resources, install only the add-ons you need! Other advanced persistence services and configurations are possible and can be configured later.
setupwizard.persistence-config.title: Configure Persistence
setupwizard.persistence-config.header1: openHAB persistence services need to be configured for Item states to be persisted.
setupwizard.persistence-config.footer: More granular configurations can be configured in the persistence service settings.
setupwizard.persistence-config.default.h: The default persistence service will be used when retrieving persisted Item states and no service is explicitly specified.
Each persistence service needs to be configured with an Items and Strategies definition.
Choose which Items to persist: all Items, a group of Items, or none.
If you select a group, a Group Item will be created and you'll need to assign Items to it.
You can refine persistence settings later in Persistence Settings.
Strategies define which Item states are persisted.
Common options include persisting on every update, every change, or at regular intervals.
The restoreOnStartup strategy restores Item states when openHAB starts, while forecast strategies persist future values (i.e. weather forecasts or future prices).
Accept the defaults or adjust as needed.
The existing persistence configuration has configuration settings that cannot be reconfigured in the wizard. Use Settings -> Persistence for configuration or reset the configuration.
Are you sure you want to reset the {config} configuration?
The existing persistence configuration is defined in a configuration file and cannot be reconfigured from the wizard.
setupwizard.semantics-intro.title: Semantics Intro
setupwizard.semantics-intro.header1: With a Semantic Model, you can organize your Items in a logical structure representing Locations, Equipment and Items.
setupwizard.semantics-intro.header2: openHAB uses this tagging to automatically create Pages and to provide natural language interactions.
setupwizard.semantics-intro.body1: We recommend creating your Semantic Model from the start and sticking to it.
setupwizard.semantics-intro.body2: It will also help you creating Items from Things in a structured way.
setupwizard.semantics-intro.body3: The first step in using a Semantic Model is creating a model of your locations. You get help the first time you open the Model.
setupwizard.semantics-intro.nextDescript: In the next step you can follow the link to the Semantic Model to use a template to create your Model.
setupwizard.welcome.title: Welcome to openHAB!
setupwizard.welcome.model: Now is the right time to create your model. You find it in the Settings menu, or you can click the button.
setupwizard.welcome.bindingsInstalled: You have installed one or more bindings. Things provided by these bindings will appear in the Settings menu Things Inbox. You can accept and further configure from there.
setupwizard.welcome.footer: You can always come back to this wizard from the Help & About menu. I will remember what you have done already!
